question: What is the leave policy?
answer: Jio offers 20 days of paid leave annually, including sick and casual leave. Leaves can be availed through the HRMS portal and are subject to managerial approval. You can find complete leave policy guidelines here: https://hrms.jio.com/policies.

question: How do I apply for leave?
answer: Log into the Jio HRMS portal, go to the 'Leave' section, choose your leave type, select the dates, add remarks, and click submit. Your manager will review and approve or reject your request. For step-by-step instructions, visit: https://hrms.jio.com.

question: What is the work from home policy?
answer: Jio follows a hybrid work model. You can request WFH through the HRMS portal, which must be approved by your reporting manager. Approval depends on the nature of your work and project alignment.

question: How do I check my salary or download payslips?
answer: Login to HRMS, go to the 'Payroll' section, and view or download your payslips month-wise. Ensure your bank and tax details are updated for smooth processing. All payslip details are available at: https://hrms.jio.com.

question: When my salary is credited ?
answer: Your salary is credited at the end of month,for detail information login to HRMS and go to Payroll section

question: What is the performance review process?
answer: Jio conducts annual appraisals with mid-year feedback. Your manager will evaluate performance based on goals, deliverables, and competencies. Results are discussed in review meetings.

question: How can I request a relocation?
answer: Relocation can be requested via HRMS under 'Employee Services'. Mention the reason and preferred location. Your manager and HR will evaluate feasibility based on business needs.

question: How can I raise a complaint against my manager?
answer: If you face any misconduct or policy violation, raise a confidential grievance through the HRMS grievance portal or reach out to the HRBP assigned to your department. You can also report grievances here: https://hrms.jio.com.

question: How to get a laptop replacement?
answer: Submit a request on the IT Helpdesk Portal with the issue details. The IT team will assess the device and approve replacement if necessary.

question: How can I request for new software installation?
answer: Log in to the IT Helpdesk Portal, raise a ticket mentioning the software, version, and purpose. The IT team will process it based on licensing and compliance.

question: Where can I find Jios HR policies?
answer: HR policies are listed in detail on the HRMS portal under the 'Policies' section. It covers ethics, leaves, behavior, security, and performance guidelines. Visit this link to access all HR policies: https://hrms.jio.com/policies.

question: How do I check my salary slip?
answer: Login to HRMS, go to the 'Payroll' section, and view or download your payslips month-wise. Ensure your bank and tax details are updated for smooth processing. All payslip details are available at: https://hrms.jio.com.

question: How do I resign from Jio?
answer: To resign, submit a resignation request on HRMS under 'Employee Lifecycle'. Mention your reason and notice period. The manager and HR will review and initiate clearance. Access the resignation portal via: https://hrms.jio.com.

question: What happens after resignation?
answer: Post resignation, serve the notice period, complete knowledge transfer, return company assets, and clear dues. Your experience letter and relieving documents will be issued after full & final settlement. Access the resignation portal via: https://hrms.jio.com.

question: How to reset my corporate email password?
answer: Go to the Jio IT Helpdesk Portal, click 'Reset Password', enter your employee ID, and follow the OTP process. If locked out, contact IT support directly. You can access the portal here: https://ithelpdesk.jio.com.

question: How are projects assigned at Jio?
answer: Projects are assigned based on your skills, experience, and availability by the resource manager. You can express interest in specific domains through your manager or MyHR.

question: Can I switch to another department?
answer: Yes, internal transfers are possible. Check open positions on the Career Portal. If eligible, apply and go through internal interviews and managerial approvals.

question: How can I attend company training sessions?
answer: Enroll in programs via the Learning Management System (LMS) linked to HRMS. Some sessions need managerial approval. Certifications are awarded post-completion. Explore current offerings here: https://hrms.jio.com/training.

question: How do I contact HR for help?
answer: You can reach HR through the HRMS 'Helpdesk' tab, raise a ticket, or use the chat support option available during working hours.

question: What are the rules for remote work?
answer: Remote work is allowed based on project requirements and managerial approval. Ensure availability during work hours, log attendance, and follow data security protocols.

question: What to do in case of hardware failure?
answer: Raise a ticket on the IT Helpdesk. Include error screenshots, serial number, and a brief explanation. The IT team will arrange repair or replacement.

question: How do I report harassment at workplace?
answer: All harassment cases must be reported confidentially via the POSH (Prevention of Sexual Harassment) portal or directly to your HRBP. Immediate action will be taken as per Jio's guidelines.

question: What are the promotion criteria?
answer: Promotions are based on performance ratings, skill enhancement, role readiness, and availability of suitable positions. Discuss your career path with your manager during appraisals.

question: How to update my personal details?
answer: Log in to HRMS, go to 'My Profile', and click 'Edit Details'. You can update contact, address, and dependent info. Some changes may need document upload.

question: What if I forgot to punch in attendance?
answer: Use the 'Attendance Correction' feature on HRMS. Add a justification and submit for managerial approval. Repeated lapses may impact payroll.

question: Is there any mental health support?
answer: Yes, Jio offers employee wellness programs including online counselling. Visit the Wellness section in HRMS or contact the helpline mentioned there. For more, visit: https://hrms.jio.com/wellness.

question: How to raise a grievance?
answer: Go to HRMS, click on 'Grievances', describe the issue, and submit. The HR team will acknowledge and work toward a resolution within a specified SLA. You can also report grievances here: https://hrms.jio.com.

question: Where can I see my project details?
answer: Your project information is available in the 'My Projects' section of HRMS. It includes project name, manager, duration, and description.

question: Can I change my shift timings?
answer: Shift changes are subject to your manager’s approval. Submit a shift change request in HRMS and discuss with your manager for approval.

question: When are salary increments processed?
answer: Salary increments are reviewed during the annual performance cycle. Your manager submits recommendations, and HR finalizes the changes based on company budgets.

question: What is the reimbursement process?
answer: Submit reimbursement claims through HRMS > 'Claims'. Attach receipts, fill the claim form, and get it approved by your manager. Payment is processed in payroll.

question: How do I know if my leave is approved?
answer: Once your manager approves your leave on HRMS, you’ll get an email notification and status will show as 'Approved' in the 'Leave History' tab.

question: Can I request for a sabbatical?
answer: Yes, Jio allows sabbaticals in special cases like education or personal emergencies. Speak to your HRBP and submit a formal request via HRMS.

question: What if my manager is not approving leave?
answer: If approval is delayed, remind your manager via email or Teams. If the issue persists, escalate to HR or your department head.

question: Are there team-building events?
answer: Yes, Jio organizes annual and quarterly team-building events. You can find upcoming events under the HRMS 'Events' section or internal newsletters.

question: Can I use my own laptop for office work?
answer: Using personal laptops is not recommended due to security policies. If absolutely required, it must be registered and approved by IT Security team.

question: How to apply for paternity/maternity leave?
answer: Go to HRMS > 'Leave' > 'Special Leave' and choose maternity/paternity. Upload supporting documents and submit for approval. Duration depends on policy guidelines.

question: How is my attendance tracked?
answer: Attendance is recorded via biometric devices or the HRMS mobile app. You can view your logs in HRMS > 'Attendance'. Ensure regular check-ins to avoid issues.

question: Where can I update my emergency contact?
answer: Go to HRMS > 'My Profile' > 'Emergency Contact Info' and update the relevant fields. Always keep this information up-to-date for safety purposes.

question: Can I decline a project assignment?
answer: You can discuss your concerns with your manager. Final decisions depend on business needs, but your preferences and workload will be considered.

question: What is the travel reimbursement policy?
answer: Travel expenses for business trips are reimbursed as per Jio's travel policy. Submit receipts and itinerary on HRMS within 7 days of travel.

question: How to apply for an internal position?
answer: Go to HRMS > 'Career' > 'Internal Job Postings'. Browse openings, click 'Apply', and track application status from the same portal.

question: What if I fall sick during office hours?
answer: Inform your manager immediately and log sick hours in HRMS. If needed, visit the office medical room or nearest hospital and report incident via mail.

question: What are the rules for overtime?
answer: Overtime is allowed in special project situations and must be pre-approved by your manager. Logged hours should be updated in HRMS for tracking.

question: How to request feedback from my manager?
answer: You can initiate feedback through HRMS > 'Performance' > 'Request Feedback'. It helps in performance tracking and career growth.

question: Is referral bonus applicable?
answer: Yes, Jio offers referral bonuses for successful employee referrals. Submit resumes via the 'Refer a Friend' section and track status in HRMS.

question: How can I refer a friend to Jio?
answer: Use the 'Employee Referral' section in HRMS to upload your friend's resume. Mention the job code or department they are applying for. If selected, you may be eligible for a referral bonus depending on the role.

question: What are the working hours at Jio?
answer: Standard working hours at Jio are 9 hours per day, typically from 9:30 AM to 6:30 PM. However, timings may vary depending on the department or shift. Flexi-hours are available upon manager's approval.

question: What to do if my laptop is not working?
answer: Raise a ticket on the IT Support Portal under 'Hardware Issues' with a detailed description. You may be asked to bring the device to the IT helpdesk or schedule a remote diagnostic session. If needed, a replacement may be provided temporarily.

question: How do I request a project change?
answer: Project change requests can be submitted via the HRMS under 'Project Allocation'. Provide a reason and your area of interest. Approval depends on current business requirements and availability of alternate projects.

question: How can I access company policies?
answer: All company policies including HR, IT, and security guidelines are available under the 'Policies' section in HRMS. You can download them in PDF for future reference. Visit this link to access all HR policies: https://hrms.jio.com/policies.

question: What is the dress code policy?
answer: Jio follows a business casual dress code. Employees are expected to wear neat and professional attire. On Fridays, smart casuals are allowed. Avoid graphic t-shirts or ripped jeans unless it's a designated casual day.

question: How do I participate in innovation challenges?
answer: Innovation challenges are posted under the 'Events' or 'Intrapreneurship' section in HRMS. Follow the guidelines, register your idea or team, and submit the proposal before the deadline.

question: What are Jio's upcoming projects?
answer: Jio is continuously innovating across multiple sectors including 5G technology, digital services, AI integration, and fiber broadband expansion. While specific project details may vary by department, major initiatives are communicated through internal town halls, newsletters, and the HRMS Events or Announcements section. To stay updated, regularly check the Jio intranet or connect with your manager for project-specific information relevant to your team or business unit.

question: What should I do if my company device is lost?
answer: If you lose your company-issued device such as a laptop or mobile, immediately report the incident to your manager and the IT Security team. You must also raise a 'Lost Asset' ticket through the Jio IT Helpdesk portal, providing details like device type, last known location, and time of loss. Additionally, file a police complaint (FIR) and upload a copy in the portal for documentation. The IT team will block access remotely to protect data, and HR will guide you on further steps including asset recovery or replacement process.

question: How do I schedule a meeting?
answer: To schedule a meeting at Jio, use Microsoft Outlook or MS Teams. Open your calendar, click on 'New Meeting', add participants, set the date and time, and include a meeting agenda. You can also book a meeting room if you're working from the office using the internal Room Booking tool. For virtual meetings, use MS Teams or Webex links. Always send a clear agenda and, if needed, follow up with minutes of the meeting (MoM) post discussion.

question: What platform should I use for virtual meetings?
answer: At Jio, the recommended platforms for virtual meetings are Microsoft Teams and Cisco Webex. These tools are officially supported and integrated with your Jio email and calendar system. You can schedule meetings, share screens, collaborate on files, and chat in real-time. Ensure that your device has the required apps installed and you're logged in with your corporate credentials. For external meetings, Zoom may be used with prior approval from IT or your manager.

question: Does Jio offer mental health support?
answer: Yes, Jio is committed to employee well-being and offers comprehensive mental health support services. Employees have access to confidential counseling sessions through the Employee Assistance Program (EAP), which can be scheduled via the 'Wellness' section in the HRMS portal. Additionally, Jio conducts regular wellness webinars, stress management workshops, and mindfulness programs. If you're feeling overwhelmed or need emotional support, you are encouraged to seek help without hesitation. All services are free and completely confidential. For more, visit: https://hrms.jio.com/wellness.

question: How do I collaborate with other teams?
answer: To collaborate with other teams at Jio, start by identifying the relevant team or stakeholder using the internal directory or Teams platform. Use Microsoft Teams for messaging, file sharing, and video calls. You can also schedule cross-functional meetings via Outlook or Teams Calendar, and use SharePoint or OneDrive for document collaboration. Always keep your manager informed when initiating interdepartmental collaboration to ensure alignment and support. For larger initiatives, formal collaboration can be documented through project charters or shared dashboards.

question: What tools does Jio use for teamwork?
answer: Jio uses a suite of collaboration tools to enhance teamwork and productivity. The primary platforms include Microsoft Teams for communication, meetings, and group chats; SharePoint and OneDrive for document sharing and co-editing; and Microsoft Outlook for scheduling and email communication. Additionally, project teams may use tools like Microsoft Planner, Jira, or Confluence for task management and tracking, depending on the department. All these tools are integrated with your Jio account and accessible via the internal portal.

question: How do I keep my work account secure?
answer: To keep your Jio work account secure, always use strong, unique passwords and avoid sharing them with anyone. Enable two-factor authentication (2FA) for added protection. Be cautious of phishing emails and do not click on suspicious links or attachments. Lock your screen when away from your device and avoid using public Wi-Fi for accessing company resources. Regularly update your system and applications to the latest security patches. If you suspect any unauthorized activity, report it immediately to the IT Security team via the Helpdesk.

question: How do I stay updated with company news?
answer: To stay informed about the latest company updates, log in to the Jio HRMS portal and check the 'News & Announcements' section regularly. Important updates are also shared via official emails, digital notice boards, internal newsletters, and leadership town halls. You can also subscribe to departmental broadcasts on Microsoft Teams to receive targeted updates specific to your function or location. Staying connected through these channels ensures you’re aware of policy changes, upcoming events, and strategic initiatives.

question: Can I suggest ideas for company improvements?
answer: Yes, Jio actively encourages employees to share ideas for organizational improvement. You can submit your suggestions through the 'Employee Voice' or 'Innovation Hub' section on the HRMS portal. These ideas are reviewed periodically by a dedicated team, and selected suggestions may be implemented or forwarded to relevant departments. For larger initiatives, you can also participate in internal innovation challenges or hackathons hosted by Jio. Your proactive contribution is always valued and may be recognized through internal rewards or appreciation programs.

question: What happens if I exceed my annual leave quota?
answer: If you exceed your annual leave quota at Jio, the additional days taken may be considered as Leave Without Pay (LWP), which could result in a salary deduction. It's important to track your leave balance regularly through the HRMS portal before applying. In some cases, excess leave may be adjusted against future earned leaves if approved by your manager. For exceptional situations like medical emergencies, you may request special consideration by contacting your HR business partner.
